titles.title: Money Where Our Mouths Are Act
Money Where Our Mouths Are Act
To prohibit the pay of Members of Congress during periods in which a Government shutdown is in effect, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on House Administration, and in addition to the Committee on Oversight and Accountability, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

bill.summary:
Money Where Our Mouths Are Act
This bill prohibits Members of Congress from being paid during a government shutdown, beginning with the 119th Congress.
